intro: Stisseria verrucosa, commonly known as the rough stisseria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences at the base of the leaves. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky soils and dry environments. Stisseria verrucosa is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
